block.p: Lara Elizabeth Schmidt and Remy White Trafelet were married yesterday by the Rev. Richard A. Burnett at Trinity Episcopal Church in Columbus, Ohio.

Mr. and Mrs. Trafelet work in New York, the bride as the director of sales for Circline Inc., which sells art and antiques online, and the bridegroom as the managing partner of Trafelet & Company, a hedge fund.
Lara Elizabeth Schmidt and Remy White Trafelet were married yesterday by the Rev. Richard A. Burnett at Trinity Episcopal Church in Columbus, Ohio.

Mr. and Mrs. Trafelet work in New York, the bride as the director of sales for Circline Inc., which sells art and antiques online, and the bridegroom as the managing partner of Trafelet & Company, a hedge fund.

The bride, 31, graduated from Lynchburg College. Her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Harry E. Schmidt III, live in Columbus, where her father is the managing director for the local office of the Georgetown Company, a real estate and financial services company. Her mother, Dr. Carolyn W. Schmidt, is a lecturer and writer on art.

The bridegroom, 30, graduated from Dartmouth College. He is a chartered financial analyst. His mother, Janet J. Trafelet of Woodstock, Ill., is a partner in Miller & Trafelet, a Chicago law firm. His father, Dean M. Trafelet, who lives in Chicago, is a retired Illinois Circuit Court judge. He is now a partner in Hedlund, Hanley & Trafelet, a Chicago law firm.
